body_html:
I also get a significant performance drop upgrading from 0.3 (via https://github.com/peterjc123/pytorch-scripts) to the official Windows 0.4.
The model is a simple feedforward network with two hidden layers and relatively small size (< 100 inputs and outputs) with ReLu or linear activation. The batch size is 24.
I'm training on an i7-7700HQ. torch.get_num_threads() is 4, setting it to 1 doesn't change much.

Previous training times for three models were:

  1. 49 s
  2. 24 s
  3. 56 s

Now, the same models use more time:

  1. 61 s
  2. 36 s
  3. 94 s

body:
I also get a significant performance drop upgrading from 0.3 (via https://github.com/peterjc123/pytorch-scripts) to the official Windows 0.4.
The model is a simple feedforward network with two hidden layers and relatively small size (< 100 inputs and outputs) with ReLu or linear activation. The batch size is 24.
I'm training on an i7-7700HQ. torch.get_num_threads() is 4, setting it to 1 doesn't change much.

Previous training times for three models were:

1. 49 s
2. 24 s
3. 56 s

Now, the same models use more time:
1. 61 s
2. 36 s
3. 94 s
